pullRequest.body:
`#trans_imports` reports how many transitive imports the current module has.
The command takes an optional string input: `#trans_imports str` also shows the transitively
imported modules whose name begins with `str`.

[Zulip discussion](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4/topic/import.20changes.20bot.20on.20PRs/near/482768569)

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [18064a1acf](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19129/commits/18064a1acf2039cceb079b3fdd5ac2b0651d1dc0)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
There are 4677 files with changed transitive imports taking up over 198584 characters: this is too many to display!
You can run `scripts/import_trans_difference.sh all` locally to see the whole output.

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Do you know what metric the GitHub bot is using to report dependency/import changes? It seems to disagree with your script, e.g. it [reports](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19527#issuecomment-2503060138) 1448 imports of Mathlib.FieldTheory.IsAlgClosed.Classification but your script says 1300 Mathlib imports / 2531 total. But I think your script does detect **changes* in imports accurately.

> Do you know what metric the GitHub bot is using to report dependency/import changes? It seems to disagree with your script, e.g. it [reports](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19527#issuecomment-2503060138) 1448 imports of Mathlib.FieldTheory.IsAlgClosed.Classification but your script says 1300 Mathlib imports / 2531 total. But I think your script does detect *_changes_ in imports accurately.

The script used in the PR summary is a text-based script, so it may have some weirdness analysing files that `import [non-mathlib]` and also files that have
````lean
```example
import Mathlib
#check myNewTheorem
```
````
in them.  I do not remember the details of how that script works, though.

This may explain why relative diffs are more consistent, since I expect these effects to be detected only on the fringes of mathlib.

Thanks! I'm not usually qualified to review meta PRs, but since I requested this PR, I asked Claude to [explain it](https://gist.github.com/alreadydone/4533d35def474651f235fdded6e1ae95) to me, and it looks good!

Thanks! I'm not usually qualified to review meta PRs, but since I requested this PR, I asked Claude to [explain it](https://gist.github.com/alreadydone/4533d35def474651f235fdded6e1ae95) to me, and it looks good!
Having the tests fail when the actual *number* of transitive imports changes may be a little too volatile.

Yeah ... ~~should we leave out the test? Or (add an option to) remove the total count from the output?~~
I think it's better to just remove the total count from the output. If the user want it they can just run `#trans_imports` without the string argument.

I decided to add a second optional argument to the command: `#trans_imports "Lean.Elab.I" at_most 500` confirms that the number of transitive imports is at most 500, but does not print the actual number.  This should be more stable and might even be useful to limit the import size of certain files.
Should this file be imported into Mathlib.Init instead? So that it's available in any Mathlib file.

I imported it in `Mathlib.Tactic.Common`.  I think that there is the intention to make the imports of `Mathlib.Init` somewhat restricted : `Mathlib.Tactic.Common` is still imported in a large part of Mathlib anyway.

pullRequest.title: feat: `#trans_imports` shows the imports of the current module
